creator: andrei.tchijov@hyperNOC.com
text:
On Windows platform getURL().getFile() from DirContextURLConnection.java:175 
returns path with mixed use of '/' and '\'.  As a result condition on line 187 
evaluates as true.  One of side effects of these is the fact that tomcat fails 
to detect that jsp file was modified. Using getURL().getFile().replace
( '\\', '/' ) cure the problem for me, but I am not sure if this is the right 
way of fixing it.
PS I think this was a problem with all betas of tomcat 4.

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
Using '\\' as path separator in the path used for a getResource call should 
fail. Calls on the directory context were successful because some normalization 
was done. This was a hack caused by Jasper and has been removed (and Jasper was 
fixed to generate platform independent paths).
